body_html:
We only have 1 PS task. However, bandwidth shouldn't be an issue in this case since we have a 9.6GB/sec peak injection bandwidth to each node. For 32 workers, the current speed is less than 2 samples per second which should sum up to 3.2GB per second.
Correction: I did a miss calculation, the actual value is much smaller because of default batch_size of 32. Processing each batch takes around 16 sec.

To provide more details about our infrastructure, we are using the XK nodes in BlueWaters supercomputer (you can find the spec here).

I will try using Heap Checker and hopefully will comeback with mode info.

Correction: I did a miss calculation, the actual value is much smaller because of default batch_size of 32. Processing each batch takes around 16 sec.
To provide more details about our infrastructure, we are using the XK nodes in BlueWaters supercomputer (you can find the spec here).

body:
We only have 1 PS task. However, bandwidth shouldn't be an issue in this case since we have a 9.6GB/sec peak injection bandwidth to each node. For 32 workers, the current speed is less than 2 samples per second which should sum up to 3.2GB per second. 
**Correction:** I did a miss calculation, the actual value is much smaller because of default batch_size of 32. Processing each batch takes around 16 sec.

To provide more details about our infrastructure, we are using the XK nodes in BlueWaters supercomputer (you can find the spec [here](https://bluewaters.ncsa.illinois.edu/hardware-summary)).

I will try using Heap Checker and hopefully will comeback with mode info.
